flows.title: Quick Decision Maker Signup
flows.description: User who already knows what they want or is in a hurry, navigates directly to the signup form after a brief scan of the homepage.
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com and quickly scan the main hero section for key benefits
Locate and click the prominent 'Get Started' or 'Apply Now' button, likely in the header or hero section
Land on the 'Sign up form' page (https://www.atob.com/get-started)
Efficiently fill in the required fields on the signup form (e.g., Company Name, Email, Phone, Fleet Size)
Click 'Submit' or 'Continue' to complete the initial application step

flows.title: In-Depth Product Researcher
flows.description: User explores the specific features, benefits, and details of the fuel card thoroughly before considering signup.
user_goals: Understand fuel card features and benefits in detail
Determine if the card meets specific fleet requirements
Gather enough information to make an informed decision
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com and read through the homepage's introductory content and value propositions
Locate and click a link like 'Learn More about our Fuel Cards' or 'View Product Details' from the homepage
Land on the 'Fuel card details' page (https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards)
Scroll through the entire product page, carefully reading sections on features, benefits, network coverage, and reporting tools
Look for FAQs or specific terms and conditions on the product page
Click the 'Apply Now' or 'Get Started' button on the product page after feeling satisfied with the information

flows.title: Cost-Conscious Price Comparer
flows.description: User's primary goal is to find information on pricing, fees, discounts, and potential savings to compare with competitors' offerings.
user_goals: Understand potential fuel savings and discounts/rebates
Compare cost-effectiveness with other fuel cards in the market
browser_actions: Navigate to https://www.atob.com and immediately scan the homepage for any mentions of 'savings', 'discounts', 'no fees', or 'pricing'
Click on a call to action or navigation link (e.g., 'Our Cards', 'Features & Pricing') that is likely to contain cost information
Land on the 'Fuel card details' page (https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards)
Quickly scroll through the product page, specifically looking for sections titled 'Pricing', 'Fees', 'How You Save', 'Rebates', or 'Cost Benefits'
If satisfactory pricing or savings information is found, click 'Get Started' to explore further or initiate an application

flows.title: Returning Visitor (Continuing Application/Re-evaluation)
flows.description: User has visited the site before, possibly started an application, and is returning to complete it or re-evaluate specific information.
user_goals: Resume a saved application or check application status
Re-confirm specific product details before proceeding
Find a login or support contact
browser_actions: Navigate directly to https://www.atob.com, likely from a browser bookmark or a follow-up email link
Look for a 'Login' or 'Continue Application' link; if not visible, click 'Get Started' assuming it will lead to a login/resume option
Land on the 'Sign up form' page (https://www.atob.com/get-started) and attempt to locate a 'Login' or 'Already Applied?' link/button
If unable to log in or continue, navigate back to the homepage to search for other options

Click 'Learn More' or 'Product Details' from the homepage to re-visit the 'Fuel card details' page (https://www.atob.com/product-fuel-cards) to confirm a specific detail they remembered or had questions about

flows.title: Mobile User On-the-Go Signup
flows.description: User accessing the site on a mobile device, likely looking for a quick and easy signup process optimized for small screens.
user_goals: Apply for a fuel card quickly via mobile device
Complete initial application with minimal effort and intuitive mobile interactions
browser_actions: Open https://www.atob.com on a mobile browser (e.g., Chrome on Android, Safari on iOS)
Quickly scroll down the mobile homepage, focusing on headlines and prominent calls to action, avoiding extensive text reading
Tap the highly visible 'Get Started' or 'Apply Now' button, which may be in a sticky header/footer or a large, central hero section button
Land on the 'Sign up form' page (https://www.atob.com/get-started), expecting a mobile-optimized layout with large input fields and clear labels
Carefully tap and input information into the mobile-friendly form fields, utilizing mobile keyboard features like auto-fill suggestions
Tap the 'Submit' button to complete the application, expecting clear success or next-step messaging
